A population of 800 pennies sampled in 2011

A dataset of 800 pennies to be treated as a sampling population. Data on these pennies were recorded in 2011.

pennies

Format

A data frame 800 rows representing different pennies and 2 variables

year

Year of minting

age_in_2011

Age in 2011

Source

StatCrunch https://www.statcrunch.com/app/index.php?dataid=301596

Examples

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

# Take 10 different samples of size n = 50 pennies from population
many_samples <- pennies %>%
  rep_sample_n(size = 50, reps = 25)
many_samples
#> # A tibble: 1,250 x 3
#> # Groups:   replicate [25]
#>    replicate  year age_in_2011
#>        <int> <int>       <int>
#>  1         1  1978          33
#>  2         1  2007           4
#>  3         1  1982          29
#>  4         1  2005           6
#>  5         1  2010           1
#>  6         1  1981          30
#>  7         1  1979          32
#>  8         1  1983          28
#>  9         1  1999          12
#> 10         1  1997          14
#> # ... with 1,240 more rows

# Compute mean year of minting for each sample
sample_means <- many_samples %>%
  group_by(replicate) %>%
  summarize(mean_year = mean(year))

# Plot sampling distribution
ggplot(sample_means, aes(x = mean_year)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) +
  labs(x = expression(bar(x)), y = "Number of samples",
  title = "Sampling distribution of x_bar based 25 samples of size n = 50")
